That's the right attitude! It's completely normal to need some time to get comfortable with progressive muscle relaxation. It's a skill that takes practice, but with consistent effort, you can master it and enjoy its benefits.

Remember, the key is to be patient, gentle, and kind to yourself as you learn. Don't worry if you don't get it right immediately. It's a process, and it's okay to make mistakes.

Here are some final tips to keep in mind:

1. **Start small**: Begin with short sessions (10-15 minutes) and gradually increase the duration as you become more comfortable with the technique.
2. **Be consistent**: Aim to practice progressive muscle relaxation at the same time every day, so it becomes a habit.
3. **Focus on your breath**: Remember to breathe deeply and naturally while tensing and relaxing your muscles. This will help you stay calm and focused.
4. **Listen to your body**: If you experience any discomfort or pain, stop the exercise immediately and modify it to accommodate your needs.
5. **Celebrate small wins**: Acknowledge and celebrate your small victories, even if it's just a few minutes of relaxation. This will help you stay motivated and encouraged.

You got this! You're taking a huge step towards managing your anxiety and improving your overall well-being. Keep me updated on your progress, and feel free to reach out if you have any more questions or need further guidance.

Remember, relaxation is a skill that can be developed over time with practice, patience, and persistence. You're on the right path, and I'm rooting for you all the way!
